modules.description: This module provides a framework for authentication/authorization with the Basic Authentication scheme as specified in "RFC 7617" (https://datatracker.
This module offers the capabilities of creating "AWS Lambda functions" (https://aws.
This module provides an annotation based Azure Functions extension implementation for Ballerina.
This module provides APIs for in-memory caching by using a semi-persistent mapping from keys to values.
The "cloud" library contains modules that are required to generate cloud artifacts of the "Ballerina" (https://ballerina.
This module provides the common cryptographic mechanisms with different algorithms.
This module provides APIs to perform email operations such as sending and reading emails using the SMTP, POP3, and IMAP4 protocols.
This module provides APIs, which perform file, file path, and directory operations, and a "Directory Listener", which is used to listen to a directory in the local file system.
This module provides an FTP client and an FTP server listener implementation to facilitate an FTP connection connected to a remote location.
This module provides an implementation for connecting and interacting with GraphQL endpoints.
This module provides an implementation for connecting and interacting with gRPC endpoints.
This module provides an implementation for connecting and interacting with HTTP and HTTP2 endpoints.
This module provides file read/write APIs and console print/read APIs.
This module provides the API for Java interoperability in Ballerina.
This module provides APIs to create new Java array instances, get elements from arrays, set elements, etc.
This module provides a framework for authentication/authorization with JWTs and generation/validation of JWTs as specified in the "RFC 7519" (https://datatracker.
This module provides APIs to log information when running applications.

This module provides a set of APIs to work with messages, which follow the Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions
(MIME) specification as specified in the "RFC 2045 standard" (https://www.
This module provides a framework for interacting with OAuth2 authorization servers as specified in the "RFC 6749" (https://datatracker.
This module provides apis for observing Ballerina services.

This module provides the Ballerina OpenAPI tooling, which will make it easy for you to start the development of
a service documented in an OpenAPI contract in Ballerina by generating the Ballerina service and client skeletons.
This module provides APIs to retrieve information about the environment variables and the current users of the Operating System.
This module provides APIs to generate pseudo-random numbers.
This module provides functions for searching, splitting, and replacing the set of characters of the string.
This module provides the common interface and functionality to interact with a database.
This module provides the functionality to schedule a Ballerina job either once or periodically and to manage the execution of those jobs.
This module provides an implementation for sending/receiving messages to/from another application process (local or remote) over connection-oriented TCP protocol.
This module facilitates developers to write automation tests for ballerina code in a simple manner.
This module provides a set of APIs that have the capabilities to generate and manipulate UTC and localized time.
This module provides Ballerina transaction manager implementation.
This module provides an implementation for sending/receiving datagrams to/from another application process (local or remote) using UDP.
This module provides the URL encoding/decoding functions.
This module provides an implementation for connecting and interacting with WebSocket endpoints.
This module provides APIs to perform conversions between "xml" and "json".
This module provides an API to transform the XML content to another XML/HTML/plain text using XSL transformations.

classes.description:
Represents the client Basic Auth provider, which is used to authenticate with an external endpoint by generating a
Basic Auth token against the provided credential configurations.

Represents the file user store based listener Basic Auth provider, which is used to authenticate the provided
credentials against the provided file user store configurations.

Represents the LDAP-based listener Basic Auth provider, which is used to authenticate the provided credentials
against the provided LDAP user store configurations.
Object to represent an AWS Lambda function execution context.
The `cache:Cache` object, which is used for all the cache-related operations.
Represents a service listener that monitors the email server location.
Represents a service listener that monitors the email server location.
Defines the Basic Auth handler for client authentication.
Defines the Bearer token auth handler for client authentication.
Defines the self signed JWT handler for client authentication.
Defines the JWT auth handler for listener authentication.
Defines the Basic Auth handler for client authentication.
Defines the Bearer token auth handler for client authentication.
Defines the self signed JWT handler for client authentication.
Represents a default persistent cookie handler, which stores persistent cookies in a CSV file.
Represents the headers of the inbound request.
Implements a cache for storing HTTP responses.
Represents a 'future' that returns as a result of an asynchronous HTTP request submission.
Defines the file store Basic Auth handler for listener authentication.
Defines the JWT auth handler for listener authentication.
Implementation of round robin load balancing strategy.
Configures the cache control directives for an `http:Request`.
Configures cache control directives for an `http:Response`.
The `io:BlockStream` is used to initialize a stream of type `io:Block`.
The `io:CSVStream` is used to initialize a stream of type CSV records.
The `io:LineStream` is used to initialize a stream of the type strings(lines).
Represents a channel, which could be used to read characters through a given ReadableByteChannel.
Represents a ReadableCSVChannel which could be used to read records from CSV file.
Represents a data channel for reading data.
Represents a channel which will allow to read.
Represents a reader which will wrap string content as a channel.
Represents a channel which could be used to write characters through a given WritableCharacterChannel.
Represents a WritableCSVChannel, which could be used to write records from the CSV file.
Represents a WritableDataChannel for writing data.
Represents a channel, which will allow to write records through a given WritableCharacterChannel.

Represents the client JWT Auth provider, which is used to authenticate with an external endpoint by issuing a
self-signed JWT against the provided JWT issuer configurations.

Represents the listener JWT Auth provider, which is used to authenticate the provided credentials (JWT) against
the provided JWT validator configurations.
Represents the headers and body of a message.
Describes the nature of the data in the body of a MIME entity.

Represents the client OAuth2 provider, which is used to generate OAuth2 access tokens using the configured OAuth2
authorization server configurations.

Represents the listener OAuth2 provider, which is used to validate the received credential (access token) by
calling the configured OAuth2 introspection server.
This represents the metric type - counter, that can be only increased by an integer number.

This represents the metric type - gauge, that can hold instantaneous, increased or decreased value
during the usage.

When used in requests, `max-age` implies that clients are not willing to accept responses whose age is greater
than `max-age`.

Indicates that the client is willing to accept responses which have exceeded their freshness lifetime by no more
than the specified number of seconds.
Setting this as the `max-stale` directives indicates that the `max-stale` directive does not specify a limit.
Indicates that the client is only accepting responses whose freshness lifetime >= current age + min-fresh.
Represents multipart primary type

Indicates that once the response has become stale, it should not be reused for subsequent requests without
validating with the origin server.
Forces the cache to validate a cached response with the origin server before serving.
Instructs the cache to not store a response in non-volatile storage.
Instructs intermediaries not to transform the payload.
Not a mutual ssl connection.
Indicates that the client is only willing to accept a cached response.

HTTP header key `pragma`.
Indicates that the response is intended for a single user and should not be stored by shared caches.
HTTP header key `proxy-authorization`.
Has the same semantics as `must-revalidate`, except that this does not apply to private caches.
Indicates that any cache may store the response.
